cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.RO, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of sensor placement in environments where localization is necessary, which is a common problem in robotics and control systems. The paper proposes a general framework for ensuring good angular coverage and applies it to a variety of problems, including sensor placement on the plane and in the presence of additional distance or visibility constraints. This suggests that the paper could be classified under several sub-categories, including computational geometry (cs.CG), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), control systems (cs.SY), robotics (cs.RO), and information theory (cs.IT).
